discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
vA characteristic of NX-API REST is:

B. It returns requested data in YAML format.

Explanation:
NX-API REST is a Cisco Nexus switch API that allows users to interact with the switch using RESTful HTTP/HTTPS requests. It typically returns data in structured formats like JSON or YAML, making it easy to parse and integrate with automation tools.

Selected Answer: D
D. It uses SSH as its transport.
Correct. NX-API REST communicates over HTTPS or SSH, ensuring secure interactions with NX-OS devices.

choices.B: It returns requested data in YAML format.
choices.C: It utilizes Java Message Service as its transport.
choices.D: It uses SSH as its transport.

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of NX-API REST?

A developer changed a project and already staged the files in Git ready to be committed. The developer discovers that a colleague has also been working on the same project in Git. Before the commit is finalized, which Git command is used to identify changes after the last commit?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Its D. The developer has already staged the files in Git and wants to identify changes since the last commit before finalizing the commit.
git diff --cached Shows staged changes (differences between the staging area and the last commit).

Selected Answer: D
According to below information , I think that answer would be: D

git diff --cached: Only shows staged changes.
git diff HEAD: Shows all changes (both staged and unstaged).

If you want to review what you've already staged for the next commit, git diff --cached is your go-to. 
If you want to review everything that has changed (staged and unstaged), git diff HEAD is the one to use

Selected Answer: A
Its A: The Cisco UCM User Data Services (UDS) API provides authenticated access and is designed to be compatible with any device. It allows user and device information retrieval in Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) without requiring complex SOAP-based interactions.

questions.question_text: Which Cisco UCM REST API is used for authenticated access and is compatible with any device?

choices.B: faster releases that have minimal features

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
There is nothing about this question in official book nor in devnet site.
So I researched 10 specialized sites. "increased code quality" is a benefit in all of them.

Selected Answer: A
TDD does not necessarily means better quality IMHO.

Selected Answer: D
D is as a result of A

Selected Answer: A
I would say the correct answer is A because of this section in official cert guide book:
"
TDD may see like a waste of time initially. Why write tests for stuff you know isn’t going to
pass? Isn’t all of this testing just wasted effort? The benefit of this style of development is
that it starts with the end goal in mind, by defining success right away. The test you create is laser focused on the application’s purpose and a clear outcome. Many programmers add too much to their code by trying to anticipate future needs or building in too much complexity for an otherwise simple problem. TDD works extremely well with the iterative nature of Agile development, with the side benefit of having plenty of test cases to show that the software works.
"

Selected Answer: A
I think this should be A. Writing tests first forces you to think about what the code is actually supposed to do and avoid superfluous things. 

While testing -can- lead to quality code, it doesn't automatically lead to that. It only ensures that the code works. You could write terribly inefficient or sloppy code that still passes tests, so I don't think D is correct.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct:
The valid answer is? A or D?

Selected Answer: D
Confusing question, but I think its D

Selected Answer: A
A key benefit of test-driven development is that it makes the developer focus on requirements before writing code. This is in contrast with the usual practice, where unit tests are only written after code. This shows that new code is actually needed for the desired feature.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct.
1. Better program design and higher code quality
2. Detailed project documentation
3. TDD reduces the time required for project development
4. Code flexibility and easier maintenance
5. With TDD you will get a reliable solution
6. Save project costs in the long run

questions.question_text: What is a benefit of test-driven development?
